snippet: One-time charges, including a $40 million settlement with Aluminum Bahrain, dragged down results, but revenue exceeded analysts’ forecasts.
abstract: Giant aluminum producer Alcoa reports that it lost $143 million in the third quarter, primarily due to $175 million in one-time charges, including a $40 million settlement with Aluminum Bahrain; revenue fell to $5.83 billion, from $6.42 billion, but still beat analysts' expectations.
lead_paragraph: One-time charges, including a $40 million settlement with Aluminum Bahrain, dragged down results, but revenue exceeded analysts’ forecasts.

headline.seo: Alcoa Reports a $143 Million Loss but Beats Analysts’ Expectations
headline.main: Alcoa Reports a Loss, but Beats Expectations
headline.print_headline: Alcoa Reports a Loss, but Beats Expectations
